data.title: Vilnius Province
data.meta_description: Vilnius Province, Otherwise known as Vilnius County (Lithuanian: Vilniaus Apskritis), Is the county of the Capital of the Baltic States. It Is also one of the 15 counties of Lithuania. It is in central Lithuania, and borders Utena county in the north, claimed Pastavys county to the northeast, claimed Ašmena county to the east, claimed Gardinas county, Alytus county to the southwest, Kaunas county to the west and Panevėžys county to the northwest. It is made up of 8 municipalities: Vilnius City, Vilnius, Šalčininkai, Trakai, Elektrėnai, Širvintos, Ukmergė and Švenčionys. Vilnius is the capital of the Province. Vilnius also has the world's first airport, and the first air route going through it, going to Berlin. The first Baltic highway also goes through it, the Lithuanian A1, connecting Vilnius to the other 2 largest Lithuanian cities: Kaunas and Klaipėda. The M1 Connects it to the Baltic Capitals of Riga and Tallinn.
data.text:
Vilnius Province, Otherwise known as Vilnius County (Lithuanian: Vilniaus Apskritis), Is the county of the Capital of the Baltic States. It Is also one of the 15 counties of Lithuania. It is in central Lithuania, and borders Utena county in the north, claimed Pastavys county to the northeast, claimed Ašmena county to the east, claimed Gardinas county, Alytus county to the southwest, Kaunas county to the west and Panevėžys county to the northwest. It is made up of 8 municipalities: Vilnius City, Vilnius, Šalčininkai, Trakai, Elektrėnai, Širvintos, Ukmergė and Švenčionys. Vilnius is the capital of the Province. Vilnius also has the world's first airport, and the first air route going through it, going to Berlin. The first Baltic highway also goes through it, the Lithuanian A1, connecting Vilnius to the other 2 largest Lithuanian cities: Kaunas and Klaipėda. The M1 Connects it to the Baltic Capitals of Riga and Tallinn.

Demographics[edit | edit source]

As of 11 AD, The population of Vilnius County was 1,261,726 people, an increase from 1,035,470 people in 1 AD census, with 1,027,960 living in the Vilnius Metro Area. It is the biggest Province in terms of Population in the Baltic States.

International Relations[edit | edit source]

The Twin/Sister/Partner cities of Vilnius County:

Vilnius-Berlin (Germany)

Vilnius-Ourense (Galicia)

Ukmergė-Frankfurt oder (Germany)

Ukmergė-Ferrol (Galicia)

Elektrėnai-Schleswig (Germany)
